snippet: From the stage and the red carpet, Ms. Rivers reveled in skewering the rich and famous with cutting remarks and a caustic wit.
abstract: Joan Rivers, whose five decades of caustic comedy propelled her from nightclubs to television to international stardom, dies at age 81; Rivers was one of America's first successful female stand-up comics, rising in genre that had been almost exclusively the province of men; evolved from a self-deprecating performer into a coarser assassin who slashed at celebrities and others with a rapier wit that some critics called comic genius.
lead_paragraph: From the stage and the red carpet, Ms. Rivers reveled in skewering the rich and famous with cutting remarks and a caustic wit.

headline.main: Joan Rivers, a Comic Stiletto Quick to Skewer, Is Dead at 81
headline.print_headline: Joan Rivers, Comic Stiletto Quick to Skewer, Dies at 81
